metadata.subject: Japan Macro Watch: USD/JPY: Buy-on-dip cycle to continue; 115-120 by end-2017

relationships.description: FX/Equity Strategist at Merrill Lynch Japan
Technical Strategist at Merrill Lynch Professional Clearing & Services
Potential meeting between Japanese Prime Minister and US President-elect discussed

analysis.purpose: Provide investment strategy and market analysis for USD/JPY currency pair and Japanese equities following US election results
analysis.significance: Market analysis from major financial institution following Trump election victory, providing insights into currency and equity market expectations

notable_quotes: A Republican sweep would first lead to JPY strength on risk aversion, but eventually be the most bullish outcome for the USD/JPY.
The market is probably more vulnerable to the USD/JPY's upside than downside.
The biggest risk to our view is that actual US fiscal easing turns out to be minimal.
red_flags: Market timing predictions that may not materialize

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this financial research document

illegal_activity.description: Standard financial research report with no illegal activity discussed

public_knowledge.context: Standard financial market analysis that would be of interest to investors and financial media following significant political events like US elections

analysis.summary: This Merrill Lynch research report analyzes USD/JPY currency trends and Japanese equity markets following the 2016 US election, predicting continued buy-on-dip cycles with USD/JPY reaching 115-120 by end-2017, while recommending banks and insurance sectors over REITs due to expected higher US rates and fiscal policies.
